definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: My only child has just started boarding-school.
sentences.chinese: 我的獨子剛剛開始他寄宿學校的生活。

sentences.english: I was living the life of an only child and loving it.
sentences.chinese: 我正在享受着獨子生活並且熱愛着這樣的生活。

sentences.english: I was a single child and grew up on a farm in Minquan.
sentences.chinese: 俺生在民權村的一個農家，是家裏的獨子。

sentences.english: Born in south Hopei, he was the only son of a peasant family.
sentences.chinese: 他出身於冀南一個農民家庭，是個獨子。

sentences.english: Jim was an only son of his parents.
The craftsman taught his son and heir how to make pots.
sentences.chinese: 向他的獨子傳授了制罐的手藝。

sentences.english: The couple lavished so much care on their only son.
sentences.chinese: 夫婦倆過分關心他們的獨子。

definition: not to hear, not to question (idiom)/to show no interest in sth/uncritical/not in the least concerned
to adopt/to give for adoption (usually to a childless relative)
to entrap/to frame/to plant false evidence against sb
eldest grandson/the eldest son of one's eldest son
to see, hear and obey (idiom); to take advice/to take sb at his word
to sound out the difficulties and retreat to avoid defeat (idiom); fig. to back out of an awkward situation/to get out on finding out what it's really like
one's own (child) (i.e. one's child by birth)/biological (parents)/birth (parents)
